abstract: G.E. plans to sell 125 million of stock in its North American retail finance unit, which handles credit cards for major retailers like Walmart, through an I.P.O. this month.
snippet: G.E. plans to sell 125 million of stock in its North American retail finance unit, which handles credit cards for major retailers like Walmart, through an I.P.O. this month.
lead_paragraph: General Electric could raise as much as $3.4 billion from its planned spin-off of its North American retail finance unit, Synchrony Financial, according to documents filed on Friday.

headline.main: G.E. Aims to Raise $3 Billion in Synchrony Financial I.P.O.
